thread.title: U2 and Take That will kick off TFI Friday with Chris Evans this week - TV
thread.title_full: U2 and Take That will kick off TFI Friday with Chris Evans this week - TV News - Digital Spy

author: Tom Eames
title: U2 and Take That will kick off TFI Friday with Chris Evans this week - TV
text: If you were expecting some classic 1990s indie bands to launch TFI Friday this week, you're going to be disappointed.That being said, U2 and Take That - two bands who were around in the decade that Chris Evans's show is synonymous with - will perform on its full series premiere on Friday (October 16). © NBC Universal / Lloyd Bishop U2 made various appearances on the cult show in the past, and will play two songs during the live broadcast.Evans said: "It wouldn't be the first episode of TFI without one of the biggest bands in the world, if not the biggest."We're over the moon that we've got U2 on the show. They're coming in specially, flying straight from a show in Antwerp and straight back to Cologne, making the time just for us, and we certainly plan to make the most of it.‎" © Channel 4 Meanwhile, punk duo Slaves, actress Saoirse Ronan and comedy legend Steve Coogan will also drop by Evans's new TFI home in Central London.TFI Friday begins its 10-part run at 8pm on Channel 4, following its one-off comeback special earlier this year.Don't expect it to return after that though, as Evans recently revealed that he will quit TFI Friday after one final series.The presenter claimed that he was "not allowed to do any more TFI Friday", as preparations for the new-look Top Gear continue.
